name: Amerivana
description:
If you enjoyed the soundtrack, you can download it here...

Stuck on a Ghost train gliding through the American midwest wheat fields, with rambling Ghost friends too quiet to hear over the rumbling tumble of machines and gears and gas and lights all sputtering right from the start...

Such an American dream,  American Ghost, and all the things that were left unsaid and all the people still left undone and drifting and smiling but still knowing they had a raw deal from the start...

And so they took this train, took their talking cats and their fancy machines and took a seat on the Amerivana, where the entertainment is free, and the ride never ends, and no one expects anything from you, just to be whoever you are, to be free right from the start...

Amerivana is my first game. Inspired by the works of Jack Kerouac and the films of David Lynch, Amerivana takes place on a mysterious ghost train gliding through the wheat fields of some kind of world. You'll find some interesting characters along the way, each with their own interesting thoughts and non sequiturs.

There's no real point to the game, just enjoy the ride, and maybe say hi to the conductor. He actually has to double as the house band since they're short on staff...

This game was made with Bitsy, a pixel-based game engine created by Adam LeDoux.
